page.title: 19Farming
page.content: There are many fairly small, family run mixed farms in our block. A typical farm would consist of 100 to 150 acres of rough grazing and cultivated land. There would be between 90 and 100 milking cows on the lower land, between 20 and 30 beef cattle on the higher ground.All the family would be involed in running the farm and some employ a farm labourer. The farm would carry around 80 sheep and 2 or 3 rams.The farmer either uses artificial insemination or hires a bull for 3-4 months.Most farms have hens to supply their own eggs and some have ducks,turkeys and geese for the Christmas market. Every farm has 2 or 3 dogs to help round up the cows and sheep,these days some farmers wives breed dogs to make extra money.Some farms also have taken in paying guests during the summer months. .
